question: What is the name of Britain's first woman Sikh MP who has been elected to The House of Commons Home Affairs Select Committee?
explanation: Britain's first woman Sikh MP Preet Kaur Gill has been elected to an influential cross-party panel in the UK Parliament that examines the workings of the Home Office. She won the Edgbaston seat for the Labour party in the June 8 snap general election, was elected to the Home Affairs Select Committee in the UK Parliament.
